name: v0.3.43
body:
- fixes: Waveguides
- fix: S-bend
- new: Black Box layer, for IP replacement
- new: Black Box cells (grating couplers) which allow creating designs that can be targeted for multiple foundries; requires IP replacement
- update: contra-directional coupler and other pcells

name: v0.3.42
body:
- Waveguide: automatic insertion of waveguide tapers for low loss routing
- Updated Process Control Monitoring (PCM) cell, including O band devices and improved test structures
- Component
  - BraggWaveguide_holes: 1D photonic crystal Bragg gratin
- Added a Library that has fabrication biasing specific to ANT
- fix for case sensitivity in loading library cells

name: v0.3.41

- update Lumerical CML

  - added O-band optical network analyzer

body:

name: v0.3.37
body:
Fix:
- library registration problem
- cell: Waveguide SWG to strip
- shrink 50 MB down to 1 MB (suspected it caused trouble with Package Manager)

New:
- cell: thermal phase shifters, O and CL band, and for low-loss multimode waveguides
- cell: taper
- layer: deep trench
- DRC: recognition for mismatched pins

Updated:

name: v0.3.26
body:
New components:
- Bragg grating PCell, with parameters from a file

- SWG_assisted_Strip_WG PCell

- 1310 nm grating coupler, ebeam_gc_te1310_8deg.gds

New functionality:
- Waveguide: support for multiple waveguide CML and models

Fixes:
- waveguide pin width rounding error, which sometimes caused false Functional Verification errors
- other minor fixes

body:

name: PinRec changed to 1/10; Waveguide.XML for waveguide types
Using SiEPIC-Tools, fix for Lumerical integration
Major release for KLayout 0.25 using Packages, split Tools and PDK
body:
We are releasing v0.3.0, which is a major restructuring of the code and splits the Tools part from the EBeam-PDK, thus supporting for multiple PDKs.
This version supports installation using KLayout 0.25's new Packages feature.

name: Leaving behind v0.1.x
body: We are moving to v0.3.0, which is a major restructuring of the code and splits the Tools part from the EBeam-PDK, thus supporting for multiple PDKs.

body:

name: v0.1.36
body:
Lots of updates between Nov 2016 and March 2017:

Major:

- support for multiple technologies
- created a GSiP technology
- addition of support for electrical connections, export to INTERCONNECT
- GSiP library of fixed and PCells, including Ring Modulator, detector, edge coupler
- GSiP CML library in INTERCONNECT
- GSiP example of transceiver

Minor:
- fixes to ebeam_dc_halfring_straight and ebeam_dc_halfring_straight_te1550
- fixes to waveguide
- auto-save before simulations
- fixes for MC warnings in INTERCONNECT, when called from KLayout
- fixes for INTERCONNECT circuit scaling
- Process Control Module (PCM) layout and Matlab analysis scripts

name: v0.1.13
body:
Updates to the Monte Carlo simulation.
- Please install the latest version of INTERCONNECT (Feb 2016 version).
- Please update the CML.  The file should be ebeam_v1.2_2016_02_19.cml.  In the Design kits section in INTERCONNECT, you should see a folder v1.2.2016_02_19 if it is correctly installed.
- Please update the scripts for KLayout.  In the SiEPIC menu, you should see "Lumerical INTERCONNECT - WtW Monte Carlo simulations"

To run a Monte Carlo simulation:
- Add one laser, and at least one detector.
- To speed up performance, it is recommended that you copy and paste one circuit at a time into a new layout.
- Verify your circuit.
- perform a single simulation to make sure it works
-  "Lumerical INTERCONNECT - WtW Monte Carlo simulations".  This performs Wafer to Wafer variability simulations.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15843200/13194518/83b50280-d749-11e5-8fa8-815777f121db.png)

name: v0.1.12
body:
Minor improvements:

name: v0.1.11
body:
- added a taper
- Monte Carlo

name: v0.1.10
body:
- Bragg grating
- Advanced Monte Carlo for waveguides
- Updated CML
- PDK Documentation on fabrication

name: v0.1.9
body:
- Windows compatible, namely Python 3 compatible.
- Improvements to INTERCONNECT integration.
- Two types of waveguides:
  - ROUND_PATH: a single polygon. exports to INTERCONNECT as a single wavelength with a length
  - Waveguide_Route: straight waveguide sections + bends, each with Pins. Exports as individual components, so you can include reflections and loss from the bends, and consider manufacturing non-uniformity.
- extra components, both GDS and compact model:
  - broad-band directional coupler
  - terminator
- PCells:
  - ring resonator made up of two directional couplers
  - Bragg grating (including compact model in INTERCONNECT)
- MZI layout scripted example - by Jaspreet

name: Verification output using KLayout's rdb & Marker Database Browser
body:
v0.1.8:

Additions:
- Verification output using KLayout's rdb & Marker Database Browser; easy to view errors in the KLayout tool

Improvements:
- multi-detector support for INTERCONNECT

Fixes:
- bug with verification; lists being over-written.

name: Lumerical INTERCONNECT integration with KLayout
body:
v0.1.7 brings Lumerical INTERCONNECT integration with KLayout
- Laser and detector PCells; user configures parameters
- netlist extraction
- Spice file generation
- call to Lumerical INTERCONNECT to simulate the Spice file; plot the results in a visualizer.

name: v0.1.6
body:
Updates:
- Python 3 / Windows compatibility: removed print ""; removed numpy
- menu item: delete extra top cells
- Correctly dealing with GUIDING_LAYER in ROUND_PATH waveguides, when user selects it
- waveguide length calculation added, including πr/4
- Spice netlist fixes -- tested that it works with Lumerical INTERCONNECT
- Added Lumerical INTERCONNECT launch to the menu
- waveguide - dialog for the radius
- floating point / rounding bug fixes 
- Verification test GDS layout, to test/showcase capabilities.

name: v0.1.5
body: Added Undo & radius dialog; bug fixes

name: Waveguide generation, auto-snapping to pins
body:
New features:
- Menu item "W": selected paths are first snapped to the nearest pins, then converted to ROUND_PATH waveguides
- Menu item "Shift-W": selected ROUND_PATH waveguides on the silicon layer are converted to paths

PinRec text required on pins
